snippet: A week before the vote, Alex Salmond lashed out at anti-independence forces and called for an inquiry into reports that the Royal Bank of Scotland might move to England.
abstract: Alex Salmond, Scotland's first minister, lashes out at anti-independence forces and calls for inquiry into reports that Royal Bank of Scotland plans to move to England in the event of a 'yes' vote; bank's contingency plan is prompted by uncertainty over what currency an independent Scotland would use; Lloyds Banking Group has also said it would move to England should voters in Scotland decide to sever ties with Britain.
lead_paragraph: A week before the vote, Alex Salmond lashed out at anti-independence forces and called for an inquiry into reports that the Royal Bank of Scotland might move to England.

headline.main: Scot Backing Independence Says Rivals Use ‘Bullying’
headline.print_headline: Scot Backing Independence Says Rivals Use ‘Bullying’
